section.title: Install the DNS Service with InfoBlox
section.para: &kw-hos; DNS Service can be installed with the InfoBlox back-end instead of the default PowerDNS back-end. To use InfoBlox as the back-end, all prerequisites must be satisfied and the configuration of InfoBlox must be complete.

note.para: No DNS server will be deployed onto the &kw-hos; nodes. Instead, zones will be hosted on the InfoBlox servers.

important.para: Before you enable and use InfoBlox in &productname;, review the InfoBlox Deployment Guide at . Address any questions with your InfoBlox support contact.

section.title: Prerequisites

listitem.para: An existing InfoBlox system deployed within your organization.
IPs and other credentials required to access the InfoBlox WS API.
Network connectivity to and from the cluster containing designate and the InfoBlox WS API.

section.para: This information is available from your InfoBlox system administrator.

section.title: Configure the Back-end
section.para: If not already present, DNS service components must be placed on a cluster. Additionally, ensure the default bind component has been removed, and powerdns has not been added. Replace the designate-mdns component with the designate-mdns-external component.
section.screen:
control-planes: - name: control-plane-1 region-name: region1 - lifecycle-manager-target
clusters: - name: cluster1 service-components: - lifecycle-manager - mariadb - ip-cluster - apache2 - ... - designate-api - designate-central - designate-pool-manager - designate-zone-manager - designate-mdns-external - designate-client
section.para: You will need to provide DNS Service information details on your InfoBlox deployment. Open the designate pool-manager configuration template:
In the config/designate/pool-manager.conf.j2, find the following code block:
section.screen: nameservers: - host: <infoblox-server-ip> port: <infoblox-port-number> ... also_notifies: - host: <infoblox-server-ip> port: <infoblox-port-number>

step.para: Uncomment the block for infoblox and also_notifies. In Jinja2, this means replacing the {# and #} markers with {{ and }}.
Fill in the API URL, username, password, and all remaining fields.
